medical_history.chief_complaint: Worsening hypertension and general sense of feeling unwell.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient has a long history of feeling generally unwell, characterized by tiredness and achiness. Symptoms have worsened over time, particularly affecting her ability to climb stairs and walk a block. Initially, she attributed her symptoms to her elevated cholesterol level. She has experienced extreme fatigue, to the point of fearing a stroke.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension (poorly controlled), hyperlipidemia, renal artery stenosis (RAS), history of gallbladder removal (cholecystectomy), and oophorectomy.
medical_history.social_history: Does not smoke or drink alcohol; exercises three times a week; lives alone; has five healthy adult children.
